intro: Scorpiothyrsus oligotrichus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scorpiothyrsus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant is notable for its slender, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in dense clusters. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access groundwater. Scorpiothyrsus oligotrichus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is considered a valuable species for ecological studies in semi-arid environments.
